content: Today, I want to focus on renju rules in the lesson
as we have seen in ORC forum
there will be 2nd online tournament soon
hope it will be a sucessful tournament and interesting one
and as you see in the rule page
this time the tournament will be played under RIF as last one
once I want to advice to change to sakata rule in 2nd tournament
finally I give up the idea
maybe we need more discussion before that
maybe some of the members not familar with the sakata rule
how many of you played under sakata before?
me,but seems hard in real games.
do you think it is an good idea to take sakata rule in next tournament?
I know that some of you do deep ananlysis about the new rules
if we could study it in renjuclass  more than 10 lessons,maybe better.
maybe some of who say "no" explain a little more?
why do you think of sakata, author?
i think,most of us dont know sakata clearly.
yes, killer21st, we do need to discuss more
if most of us dont know it clearly,what is the purpose of tourmament?just for fun?
You can see my article in renjukings forum
firsty playing offline tournament with sakata rule
if play by new rules , maybe should play 2 different tournaments: one for who have played before, and one for beginners
then playing is more fun and equal
I suggest you all to play more in ORC
Samsite, it is hard to decide who was "beginner"
for fun, or for others purpose, or just try
everyone could join which ever tournament he/she wants?
we need to get it popular first
i seldom see sakata game in ORC
play in formal tournament is the best way to get it popular
my idea is, organise offline tournament by sakata rule giving more CP for winners, then it has more time to analyse and then we get more theory and game database
then virag can get more CP =)
whywhy, in the renlib files we published in games archive, you can search for SAKATA and find a lot of those games
one question first, what's the difference between the time spent in games under sakata and under RIF
in sakata, more time is spent in early moves
not always, but perhaps most times
maybe need more time in opening phase for sakata
that means we need spend more time under sakata rule
especially in opening phase as lu said
there should be some lessons on basic concepts of the rules first maybe before an official tournament
that's the reason we discuss it now
no conclusion, and discussion open for all of you
yes,that is 10 lessons what i said
but I think there will be no conclussion even after 100 lesson:)

tommy, smallpig, kaka, Aurora, Andry, luwenzhe, SamSite, casar, whte, shuwang, Morden, AUTHOR, mayhem, xfeifeix, Intotherenju, ouyang, alala, yzhnie, moocheng, fallnavy, swordblue, SSHJ, mikn1, whywhy, yun_shou, H8, killer21st, virag, bm, sunrain, LiuJianping, dittp, callings, weigui, sakura.
I prefer we can learn more about the new rules from tournaments as well as from lessons
I'd like it's been discussed in forum :)
if cp's are given to best players, then rules should be equally fair to all :)
so we need to kick ando out of the 2nd tournament:)
We are talking about kick you, Ando :)
we are talking about renju rules
do you think is it possible to organize the future tournament under sakata rule or others?
maybe, after some time of discussion and trainning
could we discuss it on forum?
it's not easy to have a conclusion either :)
there are many discussion about renju rules in many kinds of ways
I prefer we can play more under different rules
everyone can be equal before new rules
so get ready for 3rd online tournament, maybe there will be big change:)
I found an article in RIF website
at least two months later, so enough time to prepare :)
it is an article about the rules history
and Tarannikovs (5 revers) rules, as ants said in the forum
what do you think the reason that we need new rules noadays?
only few openings are considered "fully playable"
for beginners, maybe not necessary. But for top players, too few variants to play
and more than 80 games are d3, d11, d8
in online games,few variants. but in real games, not obviously
found the rules of: "Renju with atomic bomb"  =)))))
I am not calling for new rules:) but I think we just need more choices
we dont want to draw any conclusion about what's best rule
and what's the purpose of proposing new rules?
more variants possible under new rules
this opening alive under new rules
new rules give us more choices
and we can enjoy more from renju under new rules, espcially for beginners
changing rules is not problem-free either..
I want to say once more, the purpose of this lesson is not calling for new rules
we just learn to find more choices
but do give us more choices
and we play renju not for champion only
I want you to discusse more about the tactics under sakata rule
just for the same purpose of past analyze lessons
that's one of the way we study renju

SAKATA RULE
First player puts 3 stones (from 26 openings, like with RIF standard rules).
Second player adds 4th and 5th stones (white and black) wherever he/she likes.
First player chose color (swapping or not).
Continue as RIF standard rules (with forbidden moves rule for black).
that's the brief introduction of sakata rule
do you think it is better for black or white?
hard for tentative white, I think
what do you want to be, black or white, under such rule?
but maybe better for TW if well prepared
equally hard, harder to know, what opponent has prepared
but,white could have detailed analyse about it.
what do you think of the advantage? compare with RIF rule?
becauce white can perepare a new 4-5th before a game
if one know nothing about the rule,maybe choosing white is bad.
There are so many 4-5ths in Sakata Rule, black can't perepare all
do you think white can prepare good 4/5 to all 26 openings for one game ? :)
under RIF, what do you want to be, black or white?
if you wanna a good result,you should prepair all 26 openings:)
sounds little the 26 pairs of moves, but you need hundreds of moves of analyzing for each pair :)
but only for black puts first three stones.
because under RIF,white can choose the better side
yes, that's one of the key points
under RIF, all opening have much conclusion
and makes the sakata rule and RIF quite different
but what do you think at then beginning of RIF rule, when most variants have no conclusion?
4 stones swap is quite different from 5 stones swap.
this opening is a good wxample
because black sure win and white has the right to swap to be black
which is better now? black or white?
Maybe after some time (short or long), all playable 4-5 pairs for sakata rule will be digged out :)
the first player has the right to swap now
but 4 and 5 are prepaired by white.
but he need time to think, and have little knowledge about this variant
yes, second player put 4th and 5th moves
if white had more analyze.he will win soon.
but can he make the position suitable for him?
before a tournament, do you know what side will you be?
its easier for black to make mistake
we are preparing for next WC
and the tournament will be played under sakata
and we have no idea of whether we play as black or white
no matter which side we use, our opponent is more likely to make mistakes
do you preparing for black or white?
but what if opponent has prepared your moves also ?
it only happens when people have little experience about sakata. when the rule has been popular for 100 years, for example, then who cay say which side is better?
so both players preparing for white
ye, and who get the white side will have great advantage
the first play can preapre the 4th and 5th stones
the 4th and 5th can only be playable when it is a balanced position
balance position maybe more than 200 in this opening.
If you don't know how to win under a "sure win" variant, it is not sure win for you
that's true also in RIF rule
so under sakata, not only balanced position can be play
and under RIF, also not only balanced position can be play
maybe there is a small difference, most sure win variants in RIF are known to be wins, so with usage of time it's easier to find the win than in not-so-known positions
but why so many games in d3, d8, d11
so I say the white advantage only exists when people have no much idea about that rule
Under RIF, we know the conclusion of almost all the opening
how do we know the conclusion?
the same problem existed when RIF rule was first proposed :)
after games, tournaments, and so on
because under RIF, opening is not too many
we are talking the rule itself
I think it's very very hard to research all the openings under sakata
It just means we need long time to try. and it brings more fun during this period :)
we could imagine that if white could put 4-5-6-7 stone.it's much better for white
when we know the conclusion for all variants, then it means the rule dies again
in Sakata, finding out sure wins and advantage positions will take longer, because in RIF rules the game position is very limited up to 6 moves
even if we know, its impossible to remember all
the rule can  be survive only when it is equal to both side in the long run
in Sakata, only 3 moves are basically limited
Attention please, we are not proposing "better" rule now:)
do you think sakata will have a conclusion after 100 years?
my meaning was that sakata can be lasting
if it will die again, what's the meaning to do research on it
maybe die, maybe as RIF rule now
so we can testing in future tournament:)
but RIF is better for white now than Sakata
why, killer, even if people know conclusion of all 4-5 pairs?
to think by ourself  from beginning of openings is a nice thing,y?
remember that black has the right to swap
i think we cant remember all
will you know this is good for white or black?
not today, but why not some years later?
even if u know, you cant remember all variants
you just mean that it has a lot of variants. it takes longer to find out all conclusions
but once the conclusion is known, then how could it be better for white?
then white always can surprise black with an unprepared opening
even if 4th is open, white can't always have advantage, because it would mean white would have to know everything himself :)
to remember 1000 variants or 10000 variants is quiet different for peaople
I see, killer21st. as lu said, you just mean that there are lots of varaints possible after the three stones
it maybe 62510,in these 4-5 pair,maybe 10000 is balance
so we will never have conclusion.
maybe i am wrong, i just think even if u know it is better for black or white, u cant remember the deep analysis
just as i cant remember the sure win for D4 / I7

casar, luwenzhe, SSHJ, kaka, weigui, dittp, sakura, bm, killer21st, sunrain, tommy, HEX77, mikn1, SamSite, Morden, shuwang, AUTHOR, moocheng, yzhnie, xfeifeix, ouyang, Intotherenju, mayhem, callings, whywhy, slamduk, H8, fallnavy, Ando, alala, yun_shou, smallpig, swordblue, virag.
sure, we dont want to draw conclusion that black is better or white is better
so it is a joke to say that rif had no conclusion in its beginning.
even if we have conclusion, we can't remember them like RIF variants
if variant number is too big to remember for both, then neither color can have guaranteed advantage
yes, the number of variants make harder to remember
if everything can be known and remembered, then what to play! :)
so what I want to say is sakata rule can be playable
It can help us practise our imagination:)
one must remember, that in game position, so many more things matter a lot too than just type of rules and preparation
but white can remember 26 4-5ths before a certain game
yes,playable,but it is always better for white,it's my meaning.
we dont know whether we prepare more than the opponent
white can remember 26 4-5ths before a certain game
you dont know who will be white
and both players prepare for white moves
you dont know who is lucky one
so both player can remember 26 4-5ths before a certain game
and both players are equal now
but when the game began, the two players is not equal
that makes the sakata rule playable
white can prepare for the variant, not just white
50% to be black ,is it equal for both players?
that's whu we dont play under Gomuku
may less two games between two plays:)?
renju rule is changing during the history
is to make the game more equal
whether sakata can serve the purpose well
we will never know the answer
under same conditions (most vairants have conclusions and remembered), sakata rule has  more variants to play then RIF
if two great players,white will be better.
if two great players meet in the game
but in game situation, it doesn't always matter anything
i think it is not the color decide the result
its likely to be one of the factors
but it is an important for result.
who knows somedays later people cant have better memory than nowdays :)
statistics of winning colour will tell
maybe they will play two games.
it is the skill, strongness, and some other factors important for games under every rules
how much players have drunk last night and so on :))
the discussion will last long, I think
I think maybe there is a priciple that we don't know now  can calculate whether it is good for black or for white with the positon and the angle of the stone to the center
that sounds good, 2 games then all equal
and the best way to test is just to play more
dont reject it in the first feeling
just saying that we like to be white
in future lessons, I think we can discussion more about new rules, discuss more about the rule itself, not the players strong or not, prepare more or less
discuss more about the different tactics under different rules
we can discuss how to choose 4th and 5th move
we can discuss how many 5th moves the first player need to propose
hope more discussion in ORC forum
can the 5th move choices be the same?
thank you for your discussion, especially those active speakers:)
